Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of ROTEM®-Guided Transfusion Strategy in Obstetric Haemorrhage

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the Rotunda Hospital, Dublin, this retrospective analysis included 944 women with PPH ≥1500 ml

Intervention.evidence: Participants were divided into a post-ROTEM® group (238 women) and a pre-ROTEM® group (706 women)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the impact of a ROTEM®-guided transfusion strategy on the management of postpartum haemorrhage (PPH) ≥1500 ml compared to conventional methods.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the overall consumption of blood coagulation products, measured over one year post-implementation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details are not applicable as this was a retrospective analysis.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details are not applicable as this was a retrospective analysis.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details are not applicable as this was a retrospective analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Participants were divided into a post-ROTEM® group (238 women) and a pre-ROTEM® group (706 women)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The post-ROTEM® group demonstrated a 46% reduction in fibrinogen concentrate use, a 72% decrease in Octaplas®, and a 79% reduction in platelet use, resulting in a cost saving of €51,738.
